This is an example of using the package maSigPro to find significant gene expression profile differences in time course microarray data


```{r}
# Load the libraries

# source("http://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")
# biocLite("maSigPro")
library("maSigPro")

# Load the data

endotoxin_data <- read.table("~/Dropbox/Scientific Presentations/endotoxin_data.txt", header=TRUE, quote="\"")

```

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, echo=FALSE}
plot(cars)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
